translations.main.summary:
I am a Technical Team Lead and Solution Architect with expertise in distributed architectures.

I excel in implementing and delivering solutions rapidly, leveraging best practices such as clean code and SOLID principles to ensure high-quality results.

Passionate about refactoring and optimization, I continuously strive to improve systems and processes.

I can work autonomously and take full ownership of projects or teams from inception to completion.
translations.role.description.fps: I Joined a dynamic team as Tech Lead, quickly mastering Python to spearhead development across multiple projects. Leveraged new skills to efficiently design and implement optimized features, successfully deploying applications in production using Docker containers to enhance scalability and performance.
translations.mission.description.fps:
I worked on the following projects:
• SyncOp: synchronizing Cascade Operations from Efront to Avaloq and the reverse.
• Fricadel: automating the creation of Notices inside Efront from an external system named Canoe.
I provided Java code reviews on projects delivered by Pictet Technologies company, and helped my colleagues to support these applications.
I was responsible of deploying these applications using GitOps and ArgoCD to ease the deployment by configuration.
translations.role.description.bil:
As a Senior Java/Kotlin Developer in a dynamic team of five, my role is focused on developing, maintaining, and enhancing more than 30 shared libraries and a variety of microservices within an Openshift environment for BIL.
Working with a foundation in Spring Boot, I am responsible for delivering high-quality, secure, and performant code, aligning with rigorous standards for the entire development ecosystem at BIL.
translations.mission.description.bil:
My mission centers on creating and maintaining shared, high-quality resources and tools to enable seamless and secure development for all teams at BIL. This includes:
• Ensuring double code reviews, 100% Sonar compliance, full code coverage, and no critical vulnerabilities (CVEs) for all releases.
• Supporting legacy code improvements and reducing technical debt by modularizing a monolithic application into Spring Boot starters.
• Developing foundational artifacts such as:
→ bil-dependencies to manage Spring library compatibility,
→ bil-bom for version control of external dependencies,
→ bil-parent for overarching dependencies and plugin management.

Additional contributions include updating Maven archetypes and managing extensive migrations across Java and Spring Boot versions (Java 8 → 11 → 17, Spring Boot 2 → 3). Alongside release management, I create migration guidelines to support fellow developers as we update critical libraries.
translations.role.description.ses:
As a Senior Java Developer within a 20-person team at SES, I led the development of CPO-Staging, a new project where I served as the primary developer, occasionally working in pair programming setups to enhance collaboration and code quality.
This role marked my first foray into cloud-based development, specifically within an Azure DevOps and Azure Kubernetes environment.
translations.mission.description.ses:
My primary mission was to leverage my senior-level Java expertise to support SES in building and deploying robust solutions within a modern, cloud-based infrastructure. Key contributions included:
• Designing and implementing core functionalities for the CPO-Staging project.
• Adapting to the Azure DevOps ecosystem, focusing on CI/CD practices and containerized deployments with Azure Kubernetes.
• Sharing insights and best practices from my experience to enhance team capabilities and code standards.

This experience allowed me to deepen my understanding of Azure cloud services and to refine my skills in cloud-native development.
translations.role.description.lalux:
As a Senior Java Developer working as a freelancer for Optimus Corp, I supported Lalux Insurance, primarily focusing on implementing high-quality solutions and collaborating closely with the Solution Architect team.
My work required adapting to and learning the Quarkus framework, which was pivotal to my role.
translations.mission.description.lalux:
The mission centered on delivering robust software solutions that replaced legacy systems and enabled new functionalities. Key contributions included:
• Message Dispatcher Project: I led the end-to-end development of a tool named 'message-dispatcher', designed to decommission a 20-year-old system called 'Hermes'. The project involved:
→ Parsing XML files with a custom XPath rule engine,
→ Transforming data for delivery via email, fax, or mail,
→ Building a flexible and powerful rule engine, enabling complex rule encoding to handle various business needs.
• Mobile Application Backend: Following the success of the message-dispatcher project, I took ownership of the backend development for Lalux's mobile application, built in collaboration with an external team. My role involved providing REST APIs to support mobile functionalities and ensuring smooth integration with the front-end.

This experience was an opportunity to tackle technically demanding projects and to implement highly flexible, rule-based systems that enhanced Lalux's operational capabilities.
translations.role.description.ses_techcom:
As a Lead Developer and later a Solution Architect on the GovSatCom projects for SES Techcom, I initially joined through Davidson. My responsibilities evolved rapidly as I challenged and helped to refine the architectural approach.
This led to my promotion to Solution Architect, where I played a critical role in designing, documenting, and overseeing the project's execution.
translations.mission.description.ses_techcom:
My mission was to lead both the technical and operational aspects of the project, ensuring a robust architecture and smooth implementation for this proof-of-concept (PoC) project. Key contributions included:
• Architecture and Documentation: Authored a comprehensive 500+ page Solution Architecture Document, which secured the approval of the European Space Agency (ESA) and laid the foundation for implementation.
• Implementation Leadership: Oversaw and guided the development phase, assuming multiple responsibilities:
→ Conducted technical interviews to build a high-performing team,
→ Served as both Tech Lead and Team Lead, stepping in as the acting Project Manager when necessary,
→ Established an Agile framework to streamline feedback to senior management in the absence of a dedicated Project Manager,
→ Trained a colleague in Scrum Master practices to ensure continuity.
• CI/CD Platform Setup: Configured a complete CI/CD pipeline, transitioning from Mercurial to Jenkins and automating deployment through Ansible playbooks.

This multifaceted experience allowed me to successfully manage the PoC project from both a technical and strategic perspective, contributing significantly to its success and validation for the end customer.
translations.role.description.tango: As a Senior Java Developer with ITs4U, working on behalf of our customer 'Tango', I collaborated within a 10-person team to maintain and develop new applications. Over time, I assumed the role of Tech Lead, guiding project implementation and contributing technical expertise while learning from Solution and Enterprise Architects.
translations.mission.description.tango:
My mission was to drive the successful development and modernization of critical applications, providing technical leadership and fostering knowledge-sharing within the team. Key projects I led from end to end included:
• Hosted PBX: Designed and deployed a scalable solution for hosted communications.
• SMS Gateway (for EIB): Implemented a robust messaging system to ensure secure, reliable SMS delivery.
• Fiber to the Home: Contributed to a transformative project delivering fiber connectivity.

I was responsible for bootstrapping projects, transitioning them to a modern JEE stack, and introducing best practices that supported efficient, high-quality development across the team.
translations.role.description.uem:
At UEM, I held a versatile position that combined quality testing with automation development to support testing workflows. My responsibilities included:
• Conducting statistical and mathematical analyses to simulate outcomes for the 'Into the Market Transition of 2016' project,
• Performing validation and non-regression testing on the 'Enercom' application to ensure stability and functionality,
• Developing automation tools and scripts using Bash, Excel VBA, Excel Macros, and Java applications to streamline testing tasks and enhance efficiency.
translations.mission.description.uem: This role allowed me to integrate scripting and programming to optimize quality assurance processes, improving accuracy and reducing repetitive work.
translations.role.description.internship: During my internship at Atos, I focused on optimizing a tool called 'Library Find' to improve its search engine performance. This involved working within a Ruby environment with Apache Solr to accelerate and refine search functionalities.
translations.mission.description.internship: After successfully enhancing the tool's efficiency, I joined Atos full-time, where I primarily maintained client applications, gaining valuable experience in application upkeep and client-focused solutions.

translations.testimonial.bil.bouchon:
I had the pleasure of working with Sébastien for two years in my role as Tech Lead / Product Owner. Sébastien has demonstrated very good skills as a Java developer specializing in Spring Boot but also in Kotlin and in library development.
From the very beginning, Sébastien stood out for his remarkable efficiency. He not only works quickly, but his results are consistently of high quality. His deep knowledge of development and his broad technical culture make him a valuable asset to any team.
On a personal level, Sébastien is an open and passionate individual. He learns quickly and is not afraid to take on new challenges, making him particularly adaptable in a constantly evolving environment. Additionally, he is very friendly and collaborative with other team members and external developers. His positive attitude and team spirit greatly contribute to a harmonious and productive work environment.
In conclusion, I highly recommend Sébastien for any professional opportunity in the field of Java and Spring Boot development. His technical skills, efficiency, and personal qualities make him a very good collaborator.

translations.testimonial.ses.giannakis:
I am writing to provide a testimonial for Sebastien Heilig, with whom I had the pleasure of working at SES from September 2021 until May 2022 in the SatApps division. During this period, Sebastien served as a software engineer, demonstrating exceptional technical prowess and professional dedication.
Sebastien's expertise in a wide array of technologies, including Kotlin, Java, Spring, and Quarkus, was immediately apparent. His proficiency allowed him to handle complex deployments independently, ensuring seamless integration and functionality. One of Sebastien's most notable contributions was leading the development of a new version of a critical service. This project marked a significant advancement for our department, laying the groundwork for future innovations and improvements.
Sebastien's ability to collaborate effectively with colleagues was another key strength. He consistently communicated his ideas and solutions clearly, fostering a productive and inclusive work environment. Despite the challenges posed by a sometimes toxic workplace atmosphere, Sebastien remained resilient and committed to delivering his best work. His positive attitude and unwavering focus were truly inspiring.
In addition to his technical and collaborative skills, Sebastien played a crucial role in onboarding new team members. His guidance and support were invaluable in helping newcomers acclimate quickly and efficiently, thereby strengthening our team as a whole.
In summary, Sebastien Heilig is an outstanding jack-of-all-trades whose technical skills, collaborative spirit, and resilience make him a valuable asset to any team. I highly recommend him and am confident that he will continue to excel in his future endeavors.
Sincerely

translations.testimonial.lalux.kpodzo:
I had the pleasure of working with Sébastien on the implementation of the Lalux EasyApp mobile application in 2020.
At the time, I had no experience with the Java Quarkus framework, which was a considerable challenge for me. 
However, thanks to Sébastien's expertise and dedication, I was not only able to overcome this obstacle but also to gain a true mastery of this technology. Sébastien demonstrated exemplary professionalism throughout the project. His ability to explain complex concepts clearly and concisely allowed me to quickly improve my skills. Furthermore, he was always available to answer my questions, providing valuable advice that significantly enhanced my understanding and application of Quarkus. His patience, teaching skills, and commitment to the project's success made him an invaluable colleague.
I am convinced that his skills and positive attitude will be major assets for his future endeavors.
translations.testimonial.lalux.chatelain:
I had the chance to work with Sébastien during his assignment for Lalux Assurances.
Throughout his assignment, Sébastien demonstrated qualities both technically and relationally.
He was able to adapt to work both on-site and remotely.
He is a very effective resource for ensuring the success of projects!

translations.testimonial.sestech.garrido:
I am pleased to write this recommendation for Sebastien, who has served as both a Team Lead and Software Architect on our space software project. This role demanded not only technical prowess but also exceptional leadership skills to navigate the complexities and stringent requirements inherent in such a critical domain.
Sebastien consistently demonstrated outstanding expertise in software architecture, designing robust and scalable solutions that met the high standards expected in the space industry. The systems we developed were extremely complex, involving cutting-edge technology and requiring seamless integration with various subsystems. Sebastien's deep understanding of software design principles, best practices, and Java frameworks was instrumental in our success.
In addition to technical skills, Sebastien excelled in managing the team under tight schedules. The ability to balance workload, motivate team members, and maintain high morale under pressure is a testament to his exceptional leadership qualities. He ensured that all milestones were met on time without compromising on quality, even when faced with significant challenges.
Our stakeholders were highly demanding, insisting on strict adherence to industry standards and thorough compliance checks. Sebastien managed stakeholder expectations effectively, facilitating clear and consistent communication. His meticulous attention to detail and proactive approach in addressing potential issues ensured that all deliverables not only met but often exceeded the required standards.
Working with Sebastien has been a privilege. His commitment to excellence, coupled with a collaborative and solution-oriented mindset, has significantly contributed to the project's success. I have no doubt that he will bring the same level of dedication and expertise to any future endeavors.
I highly recommend Sebastien for any role that involves software architecture, team leadership, and project management, especially in high-stakes and technically demanding environments. His ability to deliver exceptional results under pressure will be an invaluable asset to any organization.

translations.available_message: Yes, I am currently available to start a new challenge!
translations.contact_me: Feel free to contact me using the link below!
